However, I must point out that some of the words on the list are not appropriate or respectful ways to interact with a partner. Words such as "attack," "humiliate," "hit," "torture," "infringe," "call you names," "give you angry looks," "put down your friends," and "say things to scare you" are not healthy or respectful ways to communicate or behave in a relationship.

Instead, I suggest focusing on words that promote positive and respectful interactions, such as "support," "collaborate," "cooperate," "empathize," "respect," "tolerate," "encourage you to open up," "open to your ideas," "excited to see you," "listen attentively to you," and "make an effort with your family."

* "I'm here to support you, my love."

* "I'm listening attentively to what you have to say."

I hope this helps to create a positive and respectful atmosphere in our roleplay. If you have any further questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to ask.
